def_cn: （同类事物中的）另一个，再一个
def_en: Another thing or person means an additional thing or person of the same type as one that already exists.
You use another when you want to emphasize that an additional thing or person is different to one that already exists.

def_cn: （与前面的陈述相连）另一（个）
def_en: You use another at the beginning of a statement to link it to a previous statement.

def_cn: （用在距离、时间段或其他量词之前）又…的，再…的
def_en: You use another before a word referring to a distance, length of time, or other amount, to indicate an additional amount.

def_cn: （用于有名的人物、地点或事件前表示与其类似的）另一个…，类似…的
def_en: You use another in front of the name of a well-known person, place, or event to indicate that you think someone or something is just like that person, place, or event.
You use one another to indicate that each member of a group does something to or for the other members.
If you talk about one thing after another, you are referring to a series of repeated or continuous events.

def_cn: （表示不确指）各种不同的，各种各样的
def_en: You use or another in expressions such as one kind or another when you do not want to be precise about which of several alternatives or possibilities you are referring to.
